conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container it will flow into.
The image shows five baffles labeled A, B, and C, and two containers labeled D and E.
Liquid will flow from the baffles and enter either container D or E.
Baffles are designed to guide the flow of the liquid in a specific direction.
Baffle A is pointing towards container D.
Baffle B is pointing towards container E.
Baffle C is pointing towards container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container D, and liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
